description._content: Description: East Indian Immigrants. A Hindoo Girl of fourteen. Location: Guyana Date: 1870-1931 Description: East Indian Immigrants. An indentured Coolie immigrant after a short residence in the Colony; the beads and coins around his neck are gold, and are the result of his savings. Location: Guyana Date: 1870-1931 Description: East Indian Immigrants. A sirdar, or driver, foreman of a gang of Coolies on a sugar estate. Location: Guyana Date: 1870-1931 Description: East Indian Immigrants. Coolies from Bengal. Location: Guyana Date: 1870-1931 Description: East Indian Immigrants. A Hindoo Girl of high caste. Location: Guyana Date: 1870-1931 Description: East Indian Immigrants. Coolie Women who having reaped a harvest of jewellery and valuables in the colony are about to return to their native land. Location: Guyana Date: 1870-1931 Description: East Indian Immigrants. A Coolie Immigrant who has adopted English garb and customs Location: Guyana Date: 1870-1931 Our Catalogue Reference: Part of CO 1069/355 This image is part of the Colonial Office photographic collection held at The National Archives, uploaded as part of the Caribbean Through a Lens project. We have attempted to provide place information for the images automatically but our software may not have found the correct location. We need your help to fill in the gaps, to unearth the missing stories, the social and cultural memories from this selection of colonial recordings. Do you recognise anything or anyone in the photographs? Do they provoke any personal or historical memories? If so, please leave your comments, tags and stories to enrich our records. If you would like to get involved in our community project Caribbean through a lens, we would love to hear from you. For high quality reproductions of any item from our collection please contact our image library
